title: 'Left no chance to loot people': PM Modi attacks Congress in Odisha
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a public meeting in Odisha, accused the Congress of looting people and taxing low-income groups, contrasting it with BJP's relief efforts like raising income tax limits and reducing GST. He launched development projects worth over Rs 60,000 crore, emphasising Odisha's progress under a 'double-engine' government and the 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' vision.

title: Passenger held at Mumbai airport for smoking on flight from Phuket
description: Bhavya Gautam Jain, a resident of Napeansea Road in south Mumbai, was taken into custody on his arrival at the airport

title: Watch: Kerala Finance Minister K. N. Balagopal on states’ fiscal dependence on the centre
Selena Gomez-Benny Blanco wedding: Property worth Rs 728 crore booked for celebrations, Taylor Swift flies in to be the ‘flower girl’
'I Love Muhammad' row: UP cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan detained after protest turns violent
description: Police detained Tauqeer Raza Khan, chief of Ittehad-e-Millat Council, after a violent clash erupted in Bareilly following his call for an 'I Love Muhammad' protest. Authorities cited a planned conspiracy and Section 163 BNSS, while Raza claimed house arrest and police atrocities. The controversy stems from an FIR against displaying 'I Love Muhammad' boards, sparking wider protests and national debate.

title: Submit report on social and economic condition of liberated bonded labourers in a week: Shilpa Nag
description: Shilpa Nag pointed out that a few bonded labourers, who had been freed in Chamarajanagar and Gundlupet taluks, had died while some others had still not been not been issued identity cards and release certificates

title: V.D. Satheesan says UDF not perturbed by NSS support for LDF’s Sabarimala policy
description: Satheesan dismissed the question of whether the UDF would “mend fences” with NSS, saying the question was irrelevant since the UDF had no fall out with the NSS

title: ‘Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra’ sequel announced: Tovino Thomas to star in Chapter 2
description: Sequel to Malayalam superhero film ‘Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra’ announced with Tovino Thomas as lead, promising action-packed folklore adventure produced by Dulquer Salmaan

title: Salman Khan declares he would ‘1000% lie’ to protect loved ones as Twinkle Khanna claims ‘everyone is scared’ of him: ‘Agar khoon kar dia hai toh…’

Pandal hopping this Durga Puja? Here’s an app to locate parking spaces, Metro stations, and ATMs in West Bengal
At UNGA, India accuses Pakistan of ‘glorifying terror’, counters PM Shehbaz Sharif’s claims
'Proliferation of trade-restrictive actions': Brics declaration slams Trump tariffs
description: BRICS foreign ministers condemned Trump-era US tariffs as trade-restrictive actions disrupting global supply chains and economic stability. Meeting on the sidelines of UNGA80, the expanded group, including new members, also pushed for reforms in global institutions like the UN Security Council and greater representation for developing nations, underscoring their growing influence.

title: Deadly clash in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: 17 killed in Pakistan-TTP gunfight
description: Seventeen Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants were killed in a joint operation by security forces in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa's Karak district after they opened fire, injuring three personnel. A curfew was imposed for further operations. Separately, an airstrike reportedly killed 23 civilians, including women and children, in the same province, though no official statement has been issued.

title: Elon Musk shares rare Tesla moment with former Japan PM Shinzo Abe
description: Elon Musk recently shared a 2015 video showing him giving former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe a Tesla Model S test drive. Abe's delighted reaction to the innovative electric vehicle highlighted a blend of diplomacy and technology. The clip resurfaced in 2025, offering a nostalgic contrast to Musk’s recent controversies.

title: PM Modi launches projects worth Rs 60,000 crore in Odisha; BSNL’s 4G stack gets boost with 97,500 towers
‘You give the body a signal that you are fasting’: Samantha Prabhu explores the benefits of a fast-mimicking diet
Bahraich faces new ‘wolf attacks’: CM Yogi Adityanath meets families, says eliminate animal if it can’t be captured alive
'Paagal ho gaya hai kya?': Rinku Singh's hilarious dig at Arshdeep Singh goes viral
description: Indian cricketers Rinku Singh, Arshdeep Singh, and Jitesh Sharma shared a fun moment after India's Super Over win against Sri Lanka. Rinku playfully teased Arshdeep about his match-winning two wickets in the Super Over, recreating a viral reel. India, now clear favourites, will face Pakistan in the Asia Cup final.

BSF sends back Pakistani national who accidently crossed over to India
Where does power lie in Pakistan? Khawaja Asif admits to 'Hybrid Model'
description: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif defended the nation's "hybrid model" of governance, asserting military and civilian leadership operate "by consensus." He dismissed claims of army dominance, attributing such perceptions to past military rulers, while controversially labeling US democracy a "deep state." Asif maintained this arrangement, though not ideal, is a "practical necessity" for managing Pakistan's crises, despite critics branding it undemocratic.

title: From SIM boxes to fake warrants: the hidden machinery of cybercrime rackets
‘Forced to speak Hindi’: Kerala students assaulted near Red Fort
description: CPI(M) MP John Brittas has urged Delhi Police to investigate the alleged assault of two Kerala students near Red Fort. The students were reportedly beaten, stripped, and humiliated by police and locals after being falsely accused of theft. They were mocked for their traditional attire and limited Hindi, prompting Brittas to call for justice and cultural sensitivity from the force.

title: Trump says Microsoft should fire its global affairs president Lisa Monaco
Why are so many modern marriages in trouble?
Aditya Narayan recalls being beaten up by dad Udit Narayan, says they met only 3 days a month: ‘He didn’t even know when I finished 12th grade’
BPF sweep BTC polls winning 28 of 40 Bodoland Territorial Council seats
Early-morning earthquake injures 7 in northwest China’s Gansu province
Asia Cup: R Ashwin lambasts Harshit Rana's performance against Sri Lanka
description: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin slammed pacer Harshit Rana's "amateurish" bowling after India's tense Super 4s clash against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2025. Harshit conceded 54 runs, struggling with predictable deliveries, but dismissed centurion Pathum Nissanka in the final over, forcing a Super Over that India ultimately won.

title: Sonam Wangchuk detained under NSA: What to know about National Security Act
J&K: BSF IG says 'there is presence of terrorists on LoC launch pads'
description: Terrorists are positioned at Line of Control launch pads, actively seeking to infiltrate Kashmir before the onset of winter, a senior BSF officer confirmed. Security forces remain highly alert and fully prepared to thwart these attempts, which typically increase ahead of snowfall. Two infiltration bids have already been foiled this year due to tight security and modern surveillance.

title: NCERT to grant equivalence to Class 10th, 12th certificates across all school education boards
What is a harvest moon? Dates, timing, and how to watch the 2025 spectacle
Sonia Sethi appointed full-time GM of BEST nine months after Kurla bus accident
Happy Daughter's Day 2025: 51 Best wishes, quotes and messages
description: This article celebrates the unique and cherished bond between daughters and their parents, highlighting the profound love, support, and joy that define this relationship. It provides a collection of heartfelt wishes, inspiring quotes, and special messages to honor daughters on Daughter's Day, emphasizing their role as a blessing and the heart of the family.

title: From kings and landlords to communities and corporates: The changing face of Durga Puja

'I Love Muhammad' row: What sparked violent protests in UP’s Bareilly? 10 things to know
description: Protests over "I Love Muhammad" posters turned violent in Uttar Pradesh. Bareilly witnessed stone-pelting and vehicle vandalism after Friday prayers. Police used lathi charge and tear gas to disperse crowds. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered strict action against miscreants. Religious and political leaders appealed for calm. The unrest spread to several other states. Authorities ensured heightened security for upcoming festivals.

title: Man wanted for killing of Gorakhpur NEET aspirant shot dead in Rampur encounter
Vivek Oberoi lost ‘childhood sweetheart’ to blood cancer at 18, dreamed of marrying her: ‘We fell in love at 13, thought of having kids’
How new CAFE pollution check rules will benefit small cars, introduces emissions ‘pooling’
Trump's 100% drug tariffs: Indian generics spared but pose risks for pharma sector
description: US President Trump announced a 100% tariff on imported branded and patented pharmaceuticals starting October 2025, aiming to boost domestic manufacturing. Indian generic drug makers are largely unaffected initially, but concerns loom over potential tariff expansion to complex generics. Sun Pharma faces significant exposure due to its US branded portfolio.

Image of Jesus Christ replaced by Lord Krishna in Durga puja pandal
description: The image of Jesus Christ in a Vatican City-themed Durga Puja pandal in Ranchi was replaced with Lord Krishna's following objections from the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP). The VHP alleged the original display hurt Hindu sentiments and encouraged conversion. Organizers stated the decision was made by committee members to promote religious harmony, not due to protests.

title: AEDO 2025 Recruitment: BPSC receives over 9.7 lakh ‘record’ applications for 935 vacancies

Rahul Gandhi embarks on 4-nation South America visit
Telangana HC halts construction of controversial STP, orders mandatory review for relocation
'You said he was operating from India...': Pak min contradicts self on Imran Khan
description: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif faced scrutiny over contradictory claims about Imran Khan's Twitter, first stating he operated it from jail, then struggling to explain previous allegations of Indian control, citing unproven intelligence. He also affirmed China as Pakistan's reliable, long-standing ally and primary arms supplier.

title: When is Durga Ashtami 2025: Date, timings, puja vidhi, significance, and more details
'Miscreants will not be spared': CM Yogi's warning ahead of Dussehra
description: CM Yogi Adityanath has directed Uttar Pradesh authorities to take strict action against miscreants and ensure heightened security during the upcoming Dussehra celebrations. Police are instructed to identify troublemakers using video footage, especially after recent incidents, and maintain law and order, women's safety, and regulatory compliance. He also emphasized immediate arrests for rumour-mongers and vigilance against caste tensions.

VC Sajjanar is new Hyderabad Police chief
Hyderabad floods: Over 1,000 rescued after Musi River overflows
description: Heavy rains in Hyderabad caused the Musi River to overflow near Chaderghat Bridge after Himayat Sagar gates opened, leading to road closures, traffic, and flooding. Chief Minister Revanth Reddy directed officials to remain on high alert, monitor flood-prone areas, and relocate residents, with emergency teams on standby for continued rain forecasts.

'If destroyed runways look ... ': India's sharp rebuttal to Shehbaz at UN
description: India strongly countered Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's UN remarks, where he claimed Pakistan downed Indian jets and praised Trump for a ceasefire. India's UN representative, Petal Gahlot, refuted this, stating "Operation Sindoor" was an Indian action against terrorists in Pakistan and that Pakistan had pleaded for a ceasefire after threatening more attacks.

Record-breaking! Kuldeep Yadav creates history with new feat
description: Kuldeep Yadav etched his name in Asia Cup history, securing a record 13 wickets in six innings during the 2025 T20 edition with an impressive economy rate. His consistent spin and crucial breakthroughs proved instrumental for India, guiding them through tough matches. This landmark performance now bolsters India's confidence as they head into the final against Pakistan.

Adityanath urges 57,000 gram pradhans to drive “Viksit UP@2047” roadmap
Bengaluru: Class 9 girl withdraws sexual abuse claim against mom
description: A Bengaluru class nine student initially accused her mother of sexual harassment. She later told a juvenile court there was no misconduct. The girl stated she was angry with her mother for punishment. Police struggled to record her statement. The mother and sister claimed the girl was influenced by Western culture. This new version will be part of the chargesheet.

title: 30 years a slave: Abducted as 7-yr-old, Ahmedabad man returns to find home
description: A 7-year-old boy, kidnapped from Ahmedabad over three decades ago, reappeared at 35 after escaping bonded labor in Haryana. Forced to work on an animal farm, he clung to fragmented memories of his family. Now, police are assisting the man, identified as 'Raju', in his challenging quest to reunite with his long-lost relatives.

title: MP: 4-year-old hacked to death in front of mother; assailant dies after mob attack
description: A four-year-old boy was brutally killed in Indore's Aali village. A 24-year-old man attacked the child with a sharp weapon. The boy's mother was also injured while trying to intervene. Villagers confronted the assailant, who was then tied up and assaulted. Police took him to the hospital where he later died. A judicial probe has been ordered into his death.

title: ‘Bored of home food’: Ahmedabad sisters beaten by drunk mom for ordering online food
description: Two girls approached the Abhayam helpline after their inebriated mother beat them for ordering food online, citing boredom with home meals. Their parents had divorced five years prior due to the mother's lifestyle. Counsellors placed the girls, who were home for exams, in their grandparents' custody to ensure their education continued, while also counselling the mother.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
description: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: ‘Like any other customer’: Rahul Gandhi grabs a slice at Gurgaon pizzeria
description: Rahul Gandhi made a surprise stopover at a Gurgaon pizzeria on Tuesday night, accompanied by two friends. Sporting a peach T-shirt, he behaved like any other customer, waiting patiently and enjoying salad, pizza, and Coke for 45 minutes. He interacted with staff and customers, obliging selfies, and briefly discussed election results with a party spokesperson.

title: 'They didn’t want a black character': Gabrielle Union on film rejection
description: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: Billionaire Silicon Valley investor says US' H-1B visa policy could backfire
description: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.

title: Top H‑1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others; check list
description: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.
